entry.title: T-Code LTS > Landscape Transformation v2 website | all iFrames fail to display help.sap.com content
entry.content:
Dear friends,

struggling with a failure regarding 

X-FRAME-OPTIONS  and SAMEORIGIN

but I am not even sure on which side the problem is sourced. Does help.sap.com has this feature active?

I tried whitelisting with the table HTTP_WHITELIST utilized including the Handler List for the SICF service LTS also with custom IF-class to modify the header and finally I even tried utilizing T-Code UCONCOCKPIT - Unified Connectivity Cockpit with the HTTP Whitelist scenario to somehow get the help.sap.com enabled as iFrame but nothing helped.

I found quite some notes with iframe, clickjacking and whitelisting topics also addressing web dynpro but nothing which helps or has precisely mentioned LTS.

Did maybe someone else crossed this issue and somehow succeeded with this?

ANY help is much appreciated.

Kind regards 

BW

entry.title: Can we replicate data from ABAP CDS View having input parameter through SDI(Smart Data Integration)
entry.content:
I am trying to replicate data from ABAP CDS view which is having input parameter to HANA DB through SDI (Smart Data Integration). We created remote source using ABAP Adapter in SAP HANA and created virtual table on top of it.

ABAP CDS View with Input Parameter(Document Number)

 

When we do SELECT on that virtual table we get below error.

When you add the virtual table in flowgraph, the document number input parameter is not coming up.

 

 

Is it possible to replicate data from ABAP CDS View using Flowgraph? If no, what are the options to replicate the data from parameterized ABAP CDS View to SAP HANA ?

 

@GNS @GNS1 

Thank You

Best Regards,

Ajinkya Jadhav

ABAP Development  SAP HANA smart data integration SAP Landscape Transformation replication server

entry.title: How to remove a table from LTRC in an ODQ/ODP scenario
entry.content:
Hi SAP Team,

 

Could you please assist us in removing the tables from LTRC so we can retrigger them newly?

Steps performed to delete the table from LTRC:

  1. We tried to delete the table by using Expert Functions -> Delete Loaded Tables from the Configuration for the ODP Framework -> Enter table name = '/1LT/XXXXXX' and execute. It made no difference. The table is still running and calculating the access plan, even though we killed the related jobs from SLT and the source.
  2. We also tried to reset it using the program -> IUUC_REPL_RESET_OBJECT by selecting Delete components.

The above two steps did not help us drop the table from LTRC.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: COLUMN NAMES STRIPPING AFTER 30 CHARs when replicating SAP HANA DB as source SAP SLT
entry.content:
We are trying to replicate a SAP HANA table as a source using SAP SLT.
We have few column names that are more than 30 chars and SLT strips some of the columns and resulting in some duplicate columns. 

There are SAP Note that are solving a table name more than 30 chars but not COLUMN name. Please response if anyone has faced this issue

entry.title: How to send SAP SLT LTRC statistics tab data to Grafana
entry.content:
Hi,

I am just interested to find a way to fetch all the initial load statistics that I am able to see in LTRC by using a SQ: query incase if all the values are getting stored in a table or is there a way to get those values by using a script. My end goal is to show all the initial load and delta load statistics in Grafana. I need a single picture of what is happening for my tables inside my each MTID on Grafana. I don't want to click on each table and see the statistics. Can you please guide on doing this. I am quite new to SAP SLT. I didn't find any online resources. 

 

I am talking about this data. I only pasted the initial load statistics but generally I am interested in fetching both initial load and delta load statistics to Grafana. 

 

 

Thanks,

Sai.

entry.title: Re: How to detect / find out which SLT version is installed
entry.content:
1. In SAPGUI, Go to System Menu and select Status ...
  2. Click on magnifying glass icon under "SAP System data" pane
  3. Click on "Installed Product Versions"
  4. Your SLT Release and SP level will be listed here (like SLT 3.0 SP 12)

entry.title: unable to find SAP CAR table for replication in SAP datasphere
entry.content:
Hi,

We have a standalone SAP Landscape Transformation (SLT) system running on DMIS 2018. I have created a new Mass Transfer ID connected to an SAP Customer Activity Repository (CAR) system running on a HANA database. However, when creating a new replication flow in SAP Datasphere, I am unable to see any tables available for replication. I have previously created a similar Mass Transfer ID connected to an SAP R/3 system running on an ABAP stack, and I never encountered any issues with that setup.

Do you have any recommendations on how I can resolve this issue?

Thanks,

Bhat

Thanks for the help.

entry.title: ECC to S/4HANA Lift & Shift and Consolidation
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We're currently planning the migration of functionality and data from our legacy SAP ECC system to S/4HANA. Our ECC system handles front office functionalities such as Customer-to-Cash (C2C) and Sales & Distribution (S&D), integrated with peripheral systems for Order Management and Billing for multiple customers. Meanwhile, our S/4HANA system serves as the Book of Record (BoR) offering General Ledger (G/L) and Accounts Payable (AP) functionalities. Both systems interact with other enterprise and partner systems via SAP Process Integration (PI) and third-party platforms.

We've identified a "Lift & Shift" approach as the fastest and least risky migration strategy. While this may initially limit our ability to exploit S/4HANA's innovations, it will set the groundwork for future business transformation.

I would appreciate insights from those who have undertaken similar migrations:

  1. Lift & Shift: What methodology did you employ for the Lift & Shift process? Any best practices to share?

  2. Custom Code Adaptation: Did you utilize native SAP tools or third-party accelerators to adapt custom code to S/4HANA?

  3. Integration Strategy: What strategy did you follow for migrating integrations? Insights on effort and challenges would be valuable.

  4. SAP BTP: Did you use BTP to move customizations out of the core ERP system, and was this feasible with a Lift & Shift approach? If not, were there other reasons for leveraging BTP, considering the approach taken?

  5. Consolidation: Did you consider consolidating SAP instances into one? Were there any compelling reasons to maintain two separate S/4HANA instances?

  6. Data Quality and Cleansing: How did you address data quality and cleansing during the migration process? Were there specific tools or methodologies used?

  7. Testing and Validation: What testing and validation strategies did you implement to ensure the migrated data and functionalities worked as expected in S/4HANA?

  8. Change Management: Any key strategies for training and communication that helped ease the transition?

  9. Performance Optimization: Post-migration, were there any particular optimizations or adjustments required to enhance system performance in S/4HANA?

  10. Security and Compliance: How did you ensure security and compliance during the migration process? Were there any specific challenges or solutions?

I do not expect a response to all of the topics, but anything you may have valuable information to share.

Thank you in advance.

entry.title: 🚛 Migration vs. ⬆️ Upgrade: Understanding the SAP Essentials (With Real‑World Clarity!)
entry.content:
Ever heard someone say "We're upgrading to S/4HANA" when they really meant “migrating” to HANA? You’re not alone—these terms are often misunderstood, but knowing the difference is critical 💡. 

Whether you're a consultant, a technical architect, or part of a functional team, or Business users understanding the difference is crucial for planning, execution, and business alignment. Knowing the difference between migration and upgradation can help you communicate better, plan smarter, and execute projects more efficiently.

 

🏗️ Migration = Moving House

You're shifting your entire SAP landscape—platform, database, and deployment environment.
Common Scenarios:

  • On‑Prem Oracle → SAP HANA

  • On‑Prem → Cloud

  • Legacy ERP → S/4HANA (Greenfield)

Tools: SAP Migration Cockpit, DMO, LSMW, Data Services
Focus: Data quality, performance, scalability

🛠️ Upgrade = Renovation

Same house, but with brand‑new features and updates.
Typical Use‑Cases:

  • ECC 6.0 EHP5 → EHP8

  • NetWeaver, GUI → Fiori UX

  • ECC → S/4HANA via Brownfield

Tools: SUM, Maintenance Planner, SPAM/SAINT
Focus: Functionality, user experience, compliance

🔍 Quick Comparison

Factor Migration Upgrade
GoalNew platformNew version
Change TypeTech + functionalFunctional only
Data HandlingETL / cleansed loadRetain existing data
Risk LevelHigherLower
When to Choose?DB switch, greenfieldNew features, UX, support
 

🎯 Which One Do You Need?

  • Migration = Changing where or how your SAP runs

  • Upgrade = Improving what’s already there

👉 Why It Matters

  • Align teams: set clear technical vs. business objectives

  • Optimize planning: scope, budget, risk & tool choice

  • Improve communication: speak the same language across IT & business

📣 From the SAP Community

Have you tackled a migration or upgrade?

  • What was your biggest challenge—data cleanup, downtime, custom code?

  • Any tools or tips you swear by?

Drop your insights below—let’s build a resource together! 👇

📲 Let's Connect

Follow me for more SAP & S/4HANA insights, and reach out if you want to dive deeper!
LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/in/mirza-hasan-051369231

entry.title: Running Transfer Jobs of SAP SLT is getting terminated automatically after certain time
entry.content:
Hello Everyone,

We have setup SAP Landscape Transformation from SAP S/4HANA system (as the source DB) to SAP CAR system (as the target DB). We have assigned the background jobs in the following way:

We can see that the running transfer jobs is currently 1.

However, every morning we are observing that transfer jobs is becoming 0, and we need to deactivate and activate the configuration again to trigger the transfer job so that the delta load of the data can be started which were stuck previously.

Kindly suggest a solution about how to solve this issue or what can be checked from our end to resolve it.

Thanks & Regards,
Soumya
